Title: Pair of Dieties
Description: These gods were made separately and soldered together.  The squat bodies, large heads and ears, and heavy features are stylistically Hittite, although the headdress and posture have been taken from Syrian examples influenced by Egyptian styles.
Provenance: Comte Michel Tyszkiewicz Collection, Sale, HÃ´tel des commissaires priseurs, Paris, 1898, no. 221; Dikran Kelekian, Paris and New York [date and mode of acquisition unknown]; Henry Walters, Baltimore, 1909, by purchase; Walters Art Museum, 1931, by bequest.
Creator: Hittite
DisplayLocation: Centre Street: Second Floor: Ancient Near Eastern Art
